recommendations.reasoning: [EMISSIONS] europe-north2 is chosen for its consistently lowest carbon intensity (20 gCO2eq/kWh) across all forecasted hours. Compared to the source region (us-east1), europe-north2 incurs an additional annual transfer cost of $5 (Total annual transfer cost: $5/year vs $0/year). However, this additional cost yields a substantial annual emissions saving of 108.3kg CO2 (Annual emissions: 3.8kg vs 112.1kg). The cost to avoid 1kg of CO2 is approximately $0.05/kg, which is an extremely efficient trade-off, fully aligned with the EMISSIONS optimization priority.

function_metadata.description: Fetches Electricity Maps carbon-intensity forecasts for the requested zone, doing external HTTP work.
